translation.text: Maaroo, First Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: In duality and evil-mindedness, the soul-bride is blind and deaf.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: She wears the dress of sexual desire and anger.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਘਰਿ ਵਰੁ ਸਹਜੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ਛੋਹਰਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਪਿਰ ਨੀਦ ਨ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Her Husband Lord is within the home of her own heart, but she does not know Him; without her Husband Lord, she cannot go to sleep. ||1||

transliteration.text: ghar var sahaj n jānai shōhar bin pir nīd n pāī hē .1.

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵੇ ਕਿਉ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਈਐ ਸਾਚੇ ਹਾਥਿ ਵਡਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: Without serving the True Guru, how can she find peace? Glorious greatness rests in the hands of the True Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: bin satigur sēvē kiu sukh pāīai sāchē hāth vadāī hē .2.

text: ਗਿਆਨ ਖੜਗੁ ਲੈ ਮਨ ਸਿਉ ਲੂਝੈ ਮਨਸਾ ਮਨਹਿ ਸਮਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Taking up the sword of spiritual wisdom, she struggles with her mind, and hope and desire are smoothed over in her mind. ||3||

transliteration.text: giān kharag lai man siu lūjhai manasā manah samāī hē .3.

text: ਮਾ ਕੀ ਰਕਤੁ ਪਿਤਾ ਬਿਦੁ ਧਾਰਾ ॥

translation.text: From the union of the mother's egg and the father's sperm,

transliteration.text: mā kī rakat pitā bid dhārā .

text: ਜੋਤਿ ਦਾਤਿ ਜੇਤੀ ਸਭ ਤੇਰੀ ਤੂ ਕਰਤਾ ਸਭ ਠਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: The blessings of light all come from You; You are the Creator Lord, pervading everywhere. ||4||

transliteration.text: jōt dāt jētī sabh tērī tū karatā sabh thāī hē .4.

text: ਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਸਮਝ ਪੜੀ ਕਿਆ ਡਰਣਾ ॥

translation.text: Why should anyone fear, if they come to understand through the Guru?

transliteration.text: gur tē samajh parī kiā daranā .

text: ਤੂ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਦਇਆ ਕਰਿ ਦੇਖਹਿ ਦੁਖੁ ਦਰਦੁ ਸਰੀਰਹੁ ਜਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: When You, O Merciful Lord, look with Your kindness, then pain and suffering leave the body. ||5||

transliteration.text: tū daiāl daiā kar dēkhah dukh darad sarīrah jāī hē .5.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਬੈਸਿ ਰਹੇ ਭਉ ਖਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: One who sits in the home of his own self, eats his own fears.

transliteration.text: nij ghar bais rahē bhau khāiā .

text: ਕਮਲ ਬਿਗਾਸ ਹਰੇ ਸਰ ਸੁਭਰ ਆਤਮ ਰਾਮੁ ਸਖਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: His heart-lotus blossoms forth in the overflowing green pool, and the Lord of his soul becomes his companion and helper. ||6||

transliteration.text: kamal bigās harē sar subhar ātam rām sakhāī hē .6.

text: ਸਚਾ ਅਮਰੁ ਸਚੇ ਅਮਰਾ ਪੁਰਿ ਸੋ ਸਚੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਵਡਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: True is the Lord's Command; the true ones dwell in the eternal city. The True Lord blesses them with glorious greatness. ||7||

transliteration.text: sachā amar sachē amarā pur sō sach milai vadāī hē .7.

translation.text: The jugglers have staged their show, and left, like people mumbling in a dream. ||9||

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: They alone are blessed with glorious greatness at the Lord's throne,

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: who enshrine the fearless Lord in their minds, and lovingly center themselves on Him.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਖੰਡੀ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੰਡੀ ਪਾਤਾਲੀ ਪੁਰੀਈ ਤ੍ਰਿਭਵਣ ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: In the galaxies and solar systems, nether regions, celestial realms and the three worlds, the Lord is in the primal void of deep absorption. ||10||

transliteration.text: khandī brahamandī pātālī purīī tribhavan tārī lāī hē .10.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: True is the village, and true is the throne,

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਸਾਚੇ ਸਾਚੈ ਤਖਤਿ ਵਡਾਈ ਹਉਮੈ ਗਣਤ ਗਵਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: In Truth, seated upon the true throne, they are blessed with glorious greatness; their egotism is eradicated, along with the calculation of their account. ||11||

transliteration.text: sāchē sāchai takhat vadāī haumai ganat gavāī hē .11.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Calculating its account, the soul becomes anxious.

translation.text: How can one find peace, through duality and the three gunas - the three qualities?

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਏਕੁ ਨਿਰੰਜਨੁ ਦਾਤਾ ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਤੇ ਪਤਿ ਪਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: The One Lord is immaculate and formless, the Great Giver; through the Perfect Guru, honor is obtained. ||12||

transliteration.text: niramal ēk niranjan dātā gur pūrē tē pat pāī hē .12.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: In each and every age, very rare are those who, as Gurmukh, realize the Lord.

translation.text: Their minds are imbued with the True, all-pervading Lord.

text: ਤਿਸ ਕੀ ਓਟ ਗਹੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਮਨਿ ਤਨਿ ਮੈਲੁ ਨ ਕਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: Seeking His Shelter, they find peace, and their minds and bodies are not stained with filth. ||13||

transliteration.text: tis kī ōt gahī sukh pāiā man tan mail n kāī hē .13.

translation.text: Their tongues are imbued with the True Lord, the source of nectar;

text: ਹਰਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਸੰਗੀ ਭਉ ਨ ਭਰਾਤੀ ॥

translation.text: abiding with the Lord God, they have no fear or doubt.

transliteration.text: har prabh sangī bhau n bharātī .

text: ਸ੍ਰਵਣ ਸ੍ਰੋਤ ਰਜੇ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਮਿਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Hearing the Word of the Guru's Bani, their ears are satisfied, and their light merges into the Light. ||14||

transliteration.text: sravan srōt rajē gurabānī jōtī jōt milāī hē .14.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਰਖਿ ਰਖਿ ਪੈਰ ਧਰੇ ਪਉ ਧਰਣਾ ॥

translation.text: Carefully, carefully, I place my feet upon the ground.

transliteration.text: rakh rakh pair dharē pau dharanā .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: Wherever I go, I behold Your Sanctuary.

text: ਦੁਖੁ ਸੁਖੁ ਦੇਹਿ ਤੂਹੈ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਵਹਿ ਤੁਝ ਹੀ ਸਿਉ ਬਣਿ ਆਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: Whether You grant me pain or pleasure, You are pleasing to my mind. I am in harmony with You. ||15||

transliteration.text: dukh sukh dēh tūhai man bhāvah tujh hī siu ban āī hē .15.

translation.text: as Gurmukh, I realize You and praise You.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮਿ ਰਤੇ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾਈ ਹੇ ॥੧੬॥੩॥

translation.text: O Nanak, imbued with the Naam, I am detached; in the home of my own self deep within, I am absorbed in the primal void of deep meditation. ||16||3||

transliteration.text: nānak nām ratē bairāgī nij ghar tārī lāī hē .16.3.
